snippet: Research suggests that malaria parasites in the blood can actually sense when their carriers are around, and increase their numbers accordingly.
abstract: Study in journal PLoS Pathogens suggests that malaria parasites circulating in the blood may sense presence of mosquitoes and react by increasing their numbers, raising chances that insects will carry them to new host.
lead_paragraph: Research suggests that malaria parasites in the blood can actually sense when their carriers are around, and increase their numbers accordingly.

headline.print_headline: Among Malaria Parasites, Real Feel for Mosquitoes
headline.main: Among Malaria Parasites, Real Feel for Mosquitoes
